scenarioDescription:
The HD 68988 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 68988 is a star with 1.28 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.19 times its radius. It is located 198.45 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 6 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 68988 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 68988 system


HD 68988 b

HD 68988 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2002-03, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 68988 b is 626.460 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 68988 b is 13.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 68988 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 68988 c

HD 68988 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2021-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 13.20 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 68988 c is 4770.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 68988 c is 12.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 68988 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 68988, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: HD 68988 - System With 2 Exoplanets
